column3: just read the blambot free font licence
column4: just to be thorough: http://www.blambot.com/license.shtmlWhat was the font you were using threefallingleaves?  How much would it have cost?(Also an old bad habit of mine: staring for hours at fonts.)" False text

thescreamingwall 64568043120 "2013-10-20 11:53:54 GMT" https://thescreamingwall.tumblr.com/post/64568043120/zine-staplers "Hey everyone.  When I was in Japan
column2: I picked up a bunch of staplers from a stationary place.  Now while these may look like regular staplers
column3: they have something special about them.  As their magazine swings out in ninety degree increments  These are basically perfect for making A5 zines as you can staple down the centrefold like so:  They take No.10 size staples which you can collect from any stationary place. If you would like a stapler
column5: I plan to get rid of a few of these at a book/zine launch/thing in Smith’s Alternative
column6: on Tuesday evening after 6pm." True text

column1: thescreamingwall 74118743866 "2014-01-22 01:10:30 GMT" https://thescreamingwall.tumblr.com/post/74118743866/cocktail-challenge-the-water-of-life "The spice extends life. The spice expands consciousness. The spice is vital to space travel. One of the things that Frank Herbert harps on in Dune is that the spice melange tastes different every time you taste it. That as you have changed in the flow of your life
column2: so too does the flavor of spice. This demands a wide variety of herbal flavors
column3: the alcoholic equivalent of throwing your entire spice rack in a glass. Luckily
column4: I have just the things for that. Also
column5: the end product has to be blue. My mix was as follows
column6: stirred with ice: 1 part Botanivore Gin. 1 part St. George Spirits Absinthe. 1 part Canton ginger liqueur. 1 part green Chartreuse. 1.5 parts cinnamon schnapps. 1.5 parts blue curacao I chose the ingredients I did to give the greatest chance of an incredibly complex and evolving flavor
column7: particularly the Botanivor gin and absinthe from St. George Spirits and chartreuse. The cinnamon schnapps is there as Herbert is always quite clear that the [â¦moreâ¦]" True link

column1: thescreamingwall 71078726073 "2013-12-25 05:18:59 GMT" https://thescreamingwall.tumblr.com/post/71078726073/scenes-from-las-growing-magician-problem "12-19-12
column2: LOS ANGELES: New graffiti was found at LA’s George Carlin High School today marking a new height in the occult graffiti epidemic that plagues the city. Said LA Police Commissioner Crowley
column3: “They say the chalk washes away but that’s not the problem here. The issue is that these sigils are made by amateur occultists who don’t always know what they’re doing. They mean to mark their ethereal turf but several of these alignments are capable of awakening Samael.” Samael
column4: last seen slaughtering the first born sons of Egypt
column5: could not be reached for comment. We at FIMJU wanted more expert testimony however so we invited the mummified head of Necromancer John Dee from its tomb in England for an interview. Said the archetypical wizard
column6: “Where am I? Why hast thou awakened me? Oh how I long to return to the sweet embrace of death
column7: for my every moment awake is an eternity of pain!” Troubling words indeed. Commissioner Crowley. LA Police Commissioner Crowley." True link

column1: thescreamingwall 38296534033 "2012-12-19 10:50:31 GMT" https://thescreamingwall.tumblr.com/post/38296534033/liedekijn-artbook-pre-sale "emmajeans:  From now until 31 December 2012
column2: the #liedekijn artbook will be available for pre-order for $10.  From 1-31 January 2013
column3: the artbook will still be available for pre-order
column4: but the price will go up to $12… and after that
column5: the book will be on sale from the gallery (and maybe online after the exhibition
column6: if we have any left)! Books will be sent out in late March
column7: or can be collected from the opening. Remember
column8: you’re invited to the opening - 7pm 28 March 2013 at The Front Gallery
